title: Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer webchat â as it happened | Stage | The Guardian
summary: 'why do dogs walk around in circles ? they 're buffering . looking for wifi . '
'sleaford mods ? their grudges are n't funny enough . '
vic : 'i was in a punk band called jackie charlton 's eerie mansion . most of the songs were concerning interstellar travel . '
'sausage dogs are outmoded - are they quite en vogue ? '
'a lot of boy bands have old ladies ' haircuts . they 're far to groomed to be cool . '
that 's it ! thank you for all your questions .
vic and bob are in the building !

documents.title: that 's it ! thank you for all your questions
text: guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:22pm we do hope we 've been of some assistance in your endless search for answers .
look after your loved ones , because they wo n't look after you .
somethingeneric asks which would you prefer , bees for eyebrows or knees made from turtle foreskins ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:22pm vic : i do n't believe turtles have foreskins .
i do n't believe they have genitalia .
bees are beautiful thing , so i 'd probably use them for eyebrows .
a giant hornet came into our house the other day , and you do n't want to go near them .
if they start invading , watch out england.bob : do you remember that one in brighton ?
punched you in the face.vic : i brought him in with some mr sheen .
it was massive .
the wasp is the smallest bird in britain , and this one was bigger .

they 're awful things they 'll drill into your mind and inject thoughts.bob : hornet-protective ideas.vic : they inject a serum into your brain that makes you think you 're a basque separatist , even when you 're not.bob : i knew a basque separatist , and the only english they knew was `` bobby charlton '' .
it 's the nearest i 've ever been to terrorism .
you make semtex do n't you ? vic : i do c4 now , stick with that .
or good old-fashioned gunpowder.bob : in a leather pouch.vic : have you ever blown up a mountain ? bob : no , but i 've walked down one .
i let it get on with whatever it was doing do they still do that dream topping , that cream substitute ? vic : you do n't get much `` topping '' these days .
people do n't have the same puddings as they used to.bob : it 's a crying shame.vic : you prefer a good bottoming do n't you ? bob : yep , i do .
mickeysbigmouth asks : have you ever been approached to do a kids version of mulligan and o'hare ?
i image you 'd make a fortune from the merchandising rights alone .
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:16pm bob : i think kids would have been repelled by them .
they could have worn woolier jumpers vic : to disguise the fact they were murderers.bob : if you want to take someone down , it 's always about distraction .
i distract the deer , you bring it down .
and you always say : without your help bob , we would be deerless.vic : what 's your favourite hunting weapon ? bob : ball and chain.vic : mine too .
or a heavy cannon , when you 're fishing .

raleighparis asks : do you ever think about meeting up with the hards kids from your school days to see if they are still hard and try to go toe to toe with them if you think you can now take ' them ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:14pm bob : i 've met a lot of the hard lads - having said that , i was one of them .
i was always tooled up .
i met them , and they 've lived a harder life than what i have , they seem terribly old to me and i think i could have them.vic : jungle , the leader of the darlington angels - i knew him well .
their house was filthy .
they had home-brewed cider .
hard lads they used to wear moleskin top hats , and have cudgels in the waistband of their breeches .
hooligans they were called .
you would n't want to mess with them .
sarah lewis asks : vic now that shakin ' stevens has officially been voted as wales ' greatest singer how does it feel to have been there at the beginning ?
you know when u were dancing like a twat with him in that video ?
was this the highlight of your career ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:12pm bob : the best welsh singer is out of big country.vic : burke shelley from budgie , is the highest-pitched welsh singer ever .
romfordpele2008 asks : which is most romantic , sunset , sunrise or solar eclipse ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:11pm bob : last time i experienced a solar eclipse , we were in nunhead , filming randall and hopkirk .
we were having a fiddle with each other , but it got all eerie , the birds started singing and you buckled up your trousers , took your slip-ons of a gravestone , and put them back on .
would anthea turner know the most romantic time of day ? vic : sunset , from a jamaican prison.bob : sunrise is a time to look after yourself , not others.vic : what about noon ?
that would never make a romantic novel .
post-heavy lunch romance.bob : a midday affair.vic : i do n't get romantic in the morning , too busy thinking about sugar puffs .
lunch : too busy.bob : would mike read propose to anthea at midday ?
no chance .

dusk.vic : the crepuscular time.bob : when he 's about to turn on his victorian lights.vic : what drink would you offer ? bob : creme de menthe.vic : creamed menthol ? bob : it 's not creamy at all.vic : i 'd have creme de methane , on toast.bob : what about a shallow dish of advocaat , with cherries , and you say : darling we 've been together for eight months now at the bottom of the dish , there 's a ring .
i got so drunk on advocaat once , i was drunk .
at little feat at city hall .
i 've never forgotten it.vic : on house of fools , i had a large tumbler full , and i had a very light heart .
a little tipsy , but light and breezy.bob : there was a lot of it on that set .
matt berry vic : we hid it away .
bob : it 's a nice afternoon drink , with a poached egg.vic : followed by a banana , and other yellow foods .
lemon sherbert .
lemons .
peppers .
smoked haddock .
could you make a dish out of all that ? bob : a smoothie , called sunset romance.vic : we 'll try that tonight .

documents.title: 'a lot of boy bands have old ladies ' haircuts . they 're far to groomed to be cool . '
text: eddie munster asks : when it comes to perms do you prefer tight or wet ?
asking for gene wilder .
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 2:04pm vic : i like a tight wet perm .
long too .
you do n't get a demi-wave that 's wet look do you ?
they 're all tight perms .
bob : i like a white bleached perm .
you can adorn it with little bits and pieces , sweet wrappers .
a lot of professional footballers are wearing the tight perm , but as a mohican.vic : what haircut is going to come back soon ?
noel edmonds , circa 75 ?
a centre parting but high , then a waterfall into the shape of a bell .
the super side swerve has gone though , has n't it .
a lot of boybands have old ladies ' haircuts .
they 're far to groomed to be cool .
who 's the uncoolest person in the world ?
you ca n't have kanye west.bob : olly murs is pretty cool .
he is though .
vic : really cool.bob : these towie people ?
uncool.vic : puff daddy ? bob : i do n't know him - does he wear a hat ?
is there someone called sam mendes who writes plays ?
that sounds quite cool.vic : who 's the coolest wrestler ? bob : it was johnny quango , but i do n't think he 's with us any more .
the headbutting priest .
mick mcmanus had a very familiar gait.vic : and a very familiar toupee.bob : there 's a lot of toupees in wrestling.vic : stan kellet .
very cool.bob : what ' cool : you 're at mike read 's house , anthea turner 's there , and peter powell comes along in his new white ferrari , and you can sit with him .
carol vorderman is there , and beckons you in .
she says : we 've got a spare room at our place , an american-diner themed room , you can stay there .
and just before you leave mike read 's grounds , he turns off his victorian lights too quickly , and you crash into his conifer hedge .
anthea is fuming.vic : his llamas have got out onto the main road .

thank god for a full moon.bob : we jumpstart the car again , but as we 're pushing it , we trip over the remains of the victorian lights vic : you fall into a pair of cat 's eyes , look like a terminator , and are shot by peter powell.bob : it can easily happen.vic : it did .
that 's it .
the coolest night ever .

documents.title: 'sausage dogs are outmoded - are they quite en vogue ? '
text: hogarth1 asks : can you ever teach a dog to jump a five bar gate ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:56pm vic : it 's quite easy .
trampoline , give it a fighting chance.bob : my cats can high five , and that 's it .
but that 's not bad .
all dogs can jump over five bar fences , all of them that need to anyway.vic : sausage dogs are outmoded - are they quite en vogue ?
i do n't know.bob : in my day , they 'd have a tin cone put on their face , and they 'd clean drains out .
now that would be considered cruel.vic : what 's that dog that collects apples in an orchard with a really long neck ?
is there such a thing ?
it 's about two foot long , with short legs , and a really long six foot neck.bob : is it a formal dog , with shoes and that ? vic : let 's do some investigation and track this beast down .
hogarth1 asks : when the going gets tough , where does the tough go ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:52pm bob : the cobblers .
that 's where the tough boys always go trying to get their hands on the hammers and the glue .
or to the tattooist , traditionally , but not any more.vic : have you noticed how many lads take their shirts off when the sun comes out ?
they never used to.bob : they wear these little sports shorts , it 's a funny thing.vic : lads driving together in a very small car with their tops off .
why do they cram into small cars ? bob : the economics of the situation .
our era definitely prefer to be hot : afghan coats , hats .
the fellas are becoming more peacockish these days .
when did you last go to a disco ? vic : i went once and was terrified .
a bloke thought i was looking at his wife , it was scary .
i went to see pop groups , rock bands instead.bob : i was never out of them : mandy 's , madison 's , tall trees .
i drank lager and cider mixed .
then sidle up to a lass , and say i can play sweeter music than this back home .
two , i can play snooker .
three , my dad 's a bus driver .
i can get free bus rides if you 're interested .
vic : `` me uncle 's a butcher , and can get you some really cheap offal , come with me now ! ''
rabb1967 asks : did the chafing ever settle down ?

guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:46pm bob : i rubbed it so hard with ointments , it 's now worse that with the chafing - and so the circle of life continues.vic : two slices of potato , tie them on , that 'll probably do it .
bob : you rub onion on chillblanes , and it really works.vic : there 's a cure for everything in your larder .
if you stick a banana up your arse it stops you getting pregnant .
there 's an answer to everything in a larder or fruit bowl .
emile nawagamuwa asks : if an alien came to earth tomorrow , how would you explain the onion to them ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:40pm bob : a bit like an apple but more surprising ?
it 's the `` not now , not really '' fruit.vic : have you ever painted courgettes yellow and put them in your fruit bowl ?
i have n't but i intend to .

documents.title: vic : 'i was in a punk band called jackie charlton 's eerie mansion . most of the songs were concerning interstellar travel . '
text: noirnoirnoir 4d ago01 is it true vic fronted a punk band ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:39pm it was called jackie charlton 's eerie mansion .
they were a futuristic group .
most of the songs were concerning interstellar travel and astronauts getting places on long space flights .
it was still a pertinent to but if you were in a group in 1977 , you were a punk group - we had a drum machine and an electronic organ , and scientific equipment.bob : my band was dog dirt .
we did covers of all right now , and that , but also our own songs .
jack field asks : what 's your favourite cut of meat ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:36pm bob : the sirloin steak , from the cow .
i like it because it 's succulent and shaped like the sole of a dancing shoe.vic : i like the hoof .
airhorse asks : do you have any horses and which is your favourite one if you do .
why do you prefer that particular one and what is it you hate about the others so much ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:35pm vic : i 've got a few horses .
i 've an eight horse chariot as you know.bob : what 's the lead called ? vic : jonathan .
fingers is the one at the back , it actually has fingers .
what do you have on your chariot these days ? bob : i have children pull it .
misteriks asks : what type of last biscuit would you fight over , and who would win ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:33pm vic : i made a pot of tea the other day , some really nice tea , some assam , and made it in a pot and everything .
what biscuit did i want ?
i got some rich tea , and was disappointed.bob : it the slimmer 's biscuit .
not much butter.vic : i 've been hammering some hobnobs recently - i 've got them stashed in a corner of a cupboard , like a drug addict.bob : i 'm a fan of a coconut ring .
jammie dodgers are a really good biscuit too , really fresh.vic : can you still get gypsy creams ?
what would you call it now ?
traveller 's cream ? bob : biker 's delight !
funbin1 asks : flap jack or carrot cake .
discuss .
( ca n't remember who the stotts asked that question to , but it was never fully resolved and now 's the time ) .
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:31pm bob : i do n't like carrot cake - the moisture dominates it .
just for texture alone : flapjack.vic : i 'm a fan of carrot cake - or a carrot dipped in chocolate , with some oats and icing sugar .
paul ramsay asks : what do you think the man with the stick 's supposed friend terry is up to these days ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:29pm bob : he lives in man with the stick 's house , with his grown up daughters .
he runs an internet dating agency called dateline fella .
pokerbloker asks : what 's the best seafood to snog to ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:29pm vic : crabsticks ?
nakedbrunch asks : frying pan or wet fish ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:28pm bob : i like to poach fish in milk and water .
cod , not mackerel though - you 'd have an emergency on your hands .
a lot of snobbery about tinned fish.vic : do you know a way of stopping the stink of fish , say with a smoked haddock ? bob : have you got a steam oven ?
i think it 's sealed , it 's the nature of it.vic : i had one , it stunk the fridge out.bob : maybe you need a fresher fish .
jon cockroft asks : do you still do a big weekly shop or do you prefer to up a few bits throughout the week ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:27pm bob : i prefert to purchase what i 'm eating every day .
i can never predict what my appetite will dictate .
i go to the shop and purchase eg a vegetable soup.vic : once a week , definitely .
i have it all mapped out .
i know where everything is .
i draw a plan of the supermarket and my route round it .
i like getting in there , not internet shopping - i examine the new products , see what 's in it .
i use waitrose and the staff are delightful .
other supermarkets - not mentioning any - you get short shrift at the checkout .
at waitrose they 're genuinely interested in what you 've bought .
it always comes to â£ 100.bob : is that cos you only buy a â£ 100 joint of beef ?

xiaodarshan asks : vic , you lost your golf ball on the cummins field behind estorial road south in darlo in the late 1970 's did you ever find it ? i tried to help but i still worry about it guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:24pm vic : i think i had a golf ball i tried to throw at people and try and knock them out .
i probably lost quite a few .
i lost a lot of sticks down that area too .
troyka asks : vic , did you see the reformed henry cow and if so what did you think ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:23pm vic : i did , i was in the front row , and watched fred frith very closely .
he had no shoes on , was so casual in his approach .
so relaxed .
djsatan asks : were the stotts from shildon ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:22pm vic : yes , i think they are .
i think it was mentioned at one point.bob : south shields maybe ?
lynne mount asks : did you take my advice bob ?
will you never wear crocs again ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:21pm vic : i 've got an orange pair - i wore them twice .
they 're only useful for when you 're crossing a river .
then put your chelsea boots on to cross the field .
bob : i stuck lego on mine , i got excited .
you 're still exploring slip-ons are n't you ? vic : i 've crossed borneo , and the amazon in them .
in a small tight shorts , shirt and tie , black plain leather slip-ons .

documents.title: 'sleaford mods ? their grudges are n't funny enough . '
text: joeycabron asks : do you listen to sleaford mods ?

you should do guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:20pm bob : i was , but i was caught out by my teenage children , who said i was a wanker for doing so , and stopped.vic : i read all the hype , gave them the time of day , but abandoned it .
my teenage son said it was shit.bob : they appeal to people over 40 , with kids .
kids listen to electronically generated music these days vic : their grudges are n't funny enough for me to enjoy .
if i was in that type of group my grudges would be about littering and dog fouling .
and i 'd be more furious than they are .
supremed asks : have you ever met a murderer a proper murder ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:18pm vic : i have met the yorkshire ripper , and fred west , and i 'm not keen .
colin mcarthur asks : where is the best place to bury treasure ?
like , really good treasure .
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:17pm bob : i know what they mean by that.vic : first of all , somewhere not with a squirrel nearby .
if it was sid james , they 'd build a housing estate on top of it.bob : what about a police station ?
in a police station ? vic : if you have diamonds what about in madame tussauds , in the head of someone who 's not going to get removed in a hurry .
no-one on the x factor.bob : or paint them brown and put them in your rabbit hutch .
or in amongst frozen peas .
though to be honest we store all our treasure at the local laser quest , under the ticket booth .

documents.title: 'why do dogs walk around in circles ? they 're buffering . looking for wifi . '
text: steff clarke asks : bob , why do dogs walk around in circles before lying down ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:15pm vic : they 're looking for an exit , right ?
from the horrible life they lead.bob : they 're buffering .
looking for wifi.vic : dogs chase their tails because it 's the only entertainment they can create for themselves .
it 's a very simple mind , much like a baby .
busstopboxer asks : taking into account inflation and the rising cost for living how much fun do you believe tom fun & derek can have with a pound these days ?

guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:14pm bob : you can buy a ten pack of ibuprofen for 50p at my local shop.vic : it 's 30p at superdrug.bob : let the fun commence ! vic : they could roll it down a toilet roll , and see it come out the other end .
lynne mount asks : do n't you just love the nicole swarzenegger : - ) ads where she always falls over and gets a dot of yoghurt on her nose ?
they are hilarious .
how do you think kfc would get the same idea across ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:13pm bob : they are hilarious.vic : the funniest thing on tv.bob : the interesting thing is if you look closely , she never actually eats the products .
they edit cleverly around it .
my favourite ad at the moment is where that goose starts flying it 's to get rid of spots.vic : i like the one with the hoover , i 've got one at home .
it 's two twins , but they share a dog , and a dream of having the best hoover in the world .
and they 've got it.bob : i laugh out loud so much at adverts these days that i miss some , and have to use my pause button to see them all .
sam jackson asks : why do n't animals have wheels ?
guardian contributor vicandbob 16 june 2015 1:09pm vic : they do , but they 're removed at birth .

documents.title: vic and bob are in the building !
text: here they are in the guardian offices , making the most of the canteen sandwiches vic reeves and bob mortimer in the guardian offices 16 june 2015 beaumont-thomas

documents.title: post your questions for vic reeves and bob mortimer
text: vic reeves and bob mortimer are known for a huge range of comedy silliness , from game shows ( shooting stars , families at war ) to sitcom ( house of fools , catterick ) to bob 's much-followed twitter feed to on the latter include gary oldman 's microwave , heavy mice and , frequently , kfc .
but it 's the sketch-comedy characters they invented that remain perhaps the most beloved and quotable .
from the marzipan-fixated donald and davey stott , to jilted crooners mulligan and o'hare , their absurdist non-sequiturs can still render you helpless with giggles .

the comic duo are taking these and others out this year for the poignant moments tour , a variety show likely to also feature psychedelic parlour games , random props , and a certain man with the stick .
before they go , they 're joining us to answer your questions in a live webchat , from 1pm bst onwards on tuesday 16 june .
post yours in the comments below , and they 'll answer as many as possible .
probably in a very silly manner .

bulletin.text: Why are sausage dogs back in fashion? How should one wear Crocs? And what's their problem with Sleaford Mods? The duo were here to answer your questions. Read their answers here.
